Tri Alpha Energy, a company in California
has made a big advance in fusion energy.
Tri Alpha's machine is as long as two buses. It creates smoke rings of gas and then

slamms them together at nearly a
million km/h. This creates a hollow blob

of gas at around 10 million degrees
Celsius. In early experiments the gas

fell apart after just a couple of
thousands of a second.

But firing beams of high energy
particles helps keep it together.
This week the company announced that using more powerful angled beams
keeps the gas tube stable much longer.
